heading: silent treatment
subheading: and you thought space was quiet and peaceful. astronauts say the russian half of the international space station sounds like rush hour on a busy freeway. that's why they're packing earplugs for this week's repair mission to the space module. the crew will install foam covers over the fans, ducts, and vents in an effort to muffle the noise. if that doesn't work, permanent crews will just have to get used to those earplugs.
author: wired staff
